My husband and I as well as my grandparents were visiting for a wedding at a Napoleon winery. My husband and I rented the Marigold room for 3 nights while my grandparents stayed 2 nights in the Mint Room. This is my review for both.
Check in & check out was very easy. The rooms themselves were nice, accurate & pleasant. Very cutely designed & comfortable. Also the shower room was beautifully done & well supplied. We were happy with these accommodations.
We do however feel like there were some misrepresentations or emitted details that created an experience different from what we expected.
First was the access to a kitchen, cooking basics & dishes/silverware . The rentals are presented as private rooms with a shared kitchen space & shower but the kitchen can actually only be accessed by going through the event space that is also hosted in the Emporium building. At the end of your rental hall there is a door to the event space & then the kitchen at the opposite side on the same wall. This commercial kitchen had no pots, pans, cooking essentials & the countertop had been removed ( it was the plywood underneath ). It was also not as clean. When I asked the host about the pots, pans etc thinking I just couldn't find them I was told that the pots, pans etc were in the full kitchen at their other AirBNB listing across the street. I was told "You are more than welcomed to cross the street to the Armory & use the full kitchen there". When I tried to clarify that there were no pans in the kitchen of the building of my rental she said she could bring over a dish which she did end up doing (and I appreciate it) but our conversation about attempting locate pans took 2 hours. Also the other HUGE issue with the access to the kitchen was the fact that you have to go through the event space ... where they're having events. On night 1 they had a rehearsal ( wedding? ), late afternoon 2nd day was another event and the 3rd day there was a wedding. We didn't want to be rude & be the random people interrupting someone's special day so we avoided the space entirely. The listing shouldn't say there's a kitchen when none of these unique challenges are represented in the description or photos.
Secondly is the actual privacy or lack thereof in the rental space. It is presented like you're renting a private room with a shared shower & hall. Since we were renting with my grandparents it was more or less going to be private for our stay. Well the hall as I mentioned leads to a door that goes to the event space, (which has no lock). On the first night guests left through our "private entrance ". On the 3rd day we encountered the hairstylist who apparently has a suite in our hall way as she came in through the "private entrance" along with her client & they proceeded to have perm service you could smell through the hall. Her suite is not mentioned in the listing nor is it visible in any of the photos so it's not like I could have inquired after seeing something in a photo or whatever. Also on the 3rd evening either the florists or someone from the wedding was in the hall as we found bits of their flowers later. It's a bit frustrating when the rentals are not presented this way & the shower is also accessed through that hallway. I don't want to be running into salon clients in my robe.
My grandparents TV was broken. There was a large break in the screen rendering the left third of the screen displaying nothing but scramble & lines went across the whole screen. I let the host know & she said it must have been the previous guest. Not the hosts' fault but I would have thought they or the cleaning people would have noticed considering the size of the damage before my grandparents checked in & at least gave us a heads up.
Finally the parking space/lot is share with all the businesses which is fine & there are a lot of spaces so it's not likely going to be an issue even if there's an event . But the door to your "private entrance" is completely transparent glass like a storefront. So anyone walking by, (especially at night when its illuminated) can see right in. It really should be frosted or something if the shower access is in the hall.
I was conflicted when writing this review because the rooms themselves were fine overall & I appreciate that the owners are trying to maximize their business ventures but it feels like all those ventures are crashing into each other. The lack of clarity & transparency in the listing is misleading & I think if those things can be adjusted we would have had a very different expectation & experience.
